Interface_name: HTTP Server-side based on Tornado in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Tornado-based HTTP server that handles web requests, serves static files, and manages user comments through a React component.

Class Description: TornadoServer is a class that encapsulates a Tornado web server with routing, request handling, and server management capabilities.

Attributes:
- urls: [List] - A list of URL patterns and their corresponding handlers
- settings: [Dict] - Configuration settings for the Tornado application including paths, security, and debug options
- application: [tornado.web.Application] - The main Tornado web application instance

Methods:
- __init__: [Name](self) -> [None] - Initializes the server with URL routing and application settings
- run: [Name](self, port=int) -> [None] - Starts the HTTP server on the specified port and begins the I/O loop

Additional Handler Classes:
1. CommentHandler (inherits from tornado.web.RequestHandler):
   Methods:
   - post: [Name](self) -> [None] - Handles POST requests for submitting comments and redirects to the home page

2. IndexHandler (inherits from tornado.web.RequestHandler):
   Methods:
   - get: [Name](self) -> [None] - Handles GET requests for the home page, renders a React component, and displays it in a template
